comments:
Eclipse 3.2 RC6

I fired a JUnit Plug-in launch configuration and went to edit some code in the Java editor. When I tried to copy a selection in the editor, I got an error dialog saying '"Copy" did not complete normally.  Please see the log for more information.'. See error log entries below.

Looking at the stack, it seems the copy action was interpreted in the context of the JUnit view instead of the Java editor. I have JUnit as a fast view, and it pops up automatically if an error occurs. This actually happened when I got the error.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2006-06-03 22:36:54.047
!MESSAGE "Copy" did not complete normally.  Please see the log for more information.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-06-03 22:36:54.047
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.io.StringReader.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.ui.JUnitCopyAction.convertLineTerminators(JUnitCopyAction.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.ui.JUnitCopyAction.run(JUnitCopyAction.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.BaseSelectionListenerAction.runWithEvent(BaseSelectionListenerAction.java:168)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
